author: gcolvin
content: OK.  They are comparing native Rust to running the EVM in as an interpreter.  They are _not_ running the output of EVM code compiled to RISC-V.  This is a dragster to sedan comparison.

author: gcolvin
content: Yes, this references the same tests.  I can't quite tell what is being compared, but I haven't time to dig deep.  I think for sure they are comparing revm to native  RISC-V, so the comparison is not apt.  Did I understand that someone is prototyping an EOF-to-RISC-V compiler?

author: frangio_
content:
> I suspect that is just what you get for contracts written directly in RISC-V code instead of embedding an EVM interpreter.  

this is the point though right? vitalik's argument is that zkEVMs are being implemented as EVM interpreters running atop a zkVM and that we should give direct access to the underlying zkVM, so to eliminate the EVM interpreter overhead. tbh i don't understand how you do gas accounting if you do that. but i imagine it would look something like Arbitrum Stylus (i.e. eWASM?)
